title: Mastering SPSS for Research Analysis
curriculum: Week 1, Class 1: Introduction to SPSS – Interface, usage, real-world applications
Week 1, Class 2: Population vs Sample – Core statistical foundations for data analysis
Week 1, Class 3: Types of Variables – Qualitative, Quantitative, Discrete, Continuous
Week 2, Class 4: Descriptive Statistics – Mean, Median, Mode, Range, Standard Deviation
Week 2, Class 5: Inferential Statistics – Hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, p-values
Week 2, Class 6: Graphs & Charts – Histograms, bar charts, boxplots using SPSS
Week 3, Class 7: Correlation Analysis – Pearson, Spearman, interpreting output
Week 3, Class 8: Regression – Simple & Multiple linear regression in SPSS
Week 3, Class 9: Levels of Measurement – Nominal, Ordinal, Interval, Ratio scales
Week 4, Class 10: Parameters vs Statistics – Mean, Std. Dev., Proportions (Population vs Sample)
Week 4, Class 11: Data Editor Window – Data View vs Variable View, setting properties, coding
Week 4, Class 12: Hands-On Practice – Importing data, cleaning, saving `.sav` file, final Q&A

title: IELTS Crash Course for 7+ Band
curriculum: Week 1: Course Orientation – IELTS exam overview, scoring, band goals, personalized study plan
Week 2: Listening Strategies – Sections 1–4, accent exposure (UK, AUS, US), tips for note-taking
Week 3: Listening Practice – Practice tests with answer analysis, listening for keywords & tone
Week 4: Reading Techniques – Skimming, scanning, identifying keywords, passage structure
Week 5: Reading Practice – Time management, True/False/Not Given, matching headings, gap-fills
Week 6: Writing Task 1 – Data description (Academic) / Letter writing (General), structure, grammar
Week 7: Writing Task 2 – Essay types (opinion, discussion, advantage/disadvantage), argument structure
Week 8: Writing Practice – Coherence & cohesion, improving lexical resource, self-editing practice
Week 9: Speaking Part 1 – Personal Q&A, fluency building, avoiding fillers, vocabulary for daily topics
Week 10: Speaking Parts 2 & 3 – Cue card planning, extending answers, handling abstract topics
Week 11: Mock Tests – 2 full practice tests with feedback, error analysis, time pressure simulation
Week 12: Final Review – Band 7+ techniques, common mistakes, confidence tips, exam-day preparation
